free_txt: Not corrected for scattering of the fission neutrons
from components of the fission chamber.
Monte Carlo calculations show the measurement is
predicted to be 6% lower than the unscattered spectrum
at 5 MeV and 7% lower at 8 MeV relative to the yield
fabricated by CEA contained the target materials
FIGARO array of 20 neutron detectors was used
These detectors were Eljen EJ301 liquid organic
scintillators, 12.5 cm in diameter and 5 cm thick,
each being viewed by a Hamamatsu R1250A 5 inch
Gamma ray output from fission events was
investigated with a BaF2 scintillator located at
Detector efficiencies believed to be accurate to about
5% (somewhat higher near the detection threshold) are
not included in uncertainty values given.
(WNR) of the Los Alamos Neutron Science Center
The incident neutron beam at WNR is produced
by the 800 MeV proton beam, bunched to 200 ps,
Time of flight method was used to determine
the energy of incident neutrons from WNR facility as
well as for energy of fission neutrons.
The flight path from WNR spallation target to
actinide sample was 22.74 m, the flight path for
fission neutrons from sample to neutron detector was
Measured spectra were fitted with TKE as fitting
parameter, and extrapolated by Los Alamos Model.
Due to uncertainty in TKE used in LANL model
